b6387235-9b81-4d66-8368-648e17a59925.description: This microcredential signifies that the earner understands the shift from traditional approaches to resource allocation to a return-on-investment (ROI) lens, is able to identify the components of ROI, is familiar with best practices for creating sustainable business models, and has created and discussed peer and expert feedback on action plans for adopting an ROI approach at their own institution, with an emphasis on moving from survival to recovery to sustainability post pandemic.
b6387235-9b81-4d66-8368-648e17a59925.name: Strategic Finance Bronze - 2022

issuer.summary: issued by American Council on Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have written about the implications of colleges and universities shifting to an ROI lens, best practices for implementation, the changes needed to adopt it at their institution, the challenges the shift poses, and possible solutions. They have developed and refined an action plan to evaluate academic portfolio across three key metrics, identify and solve for duplication of effort within administrative services, and/or adopt an ROI lens to evaluate student success initiatives.

03fe3861-a8cb-4bb9-afa9-f28eec9b6110.description: This microcredential signifies that the earner understands the shift from traditional approaches to resource allocation to a return-on-investment (ROI) lens, is able to identify the components of ROI, is familiar with best practices for creating sustainable business models, and has created and discussed peer and expert feedback on action plans for adopting an ROI approach at their own institution, with an emphasis on moving from survival to recovery to sustainability post pandemic.
03fe3861-a8cb-4bb9-afa9-f28eec9b6110.name: Strategic Finance Bronze

issuer.summary: issued by American Council on Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have written about the implications of colleges and universities shifting to an ROI lens, best practices for implementation, the changes needed to adopt it at their institution, the challenges the shift poses, and possible solutions. They have developed and refined an action plan to evaluate academic portfolio across three key metrics, identify and solve for duplication of effort within administrative services, and/or adopt an ROI lens to evaluate student success initiatives.

3be3c7d9-9d89-4ec7-b667-85db6d82e4df.description: Agile administrators lead innovation across their campus and rise to the challenge of their rapidly changing environment to meet the needs of students and the community. They are doers who put institutional strategy and values into action every day through rapid, iterative improvement.
3be3c7d9-9d89-4ec7-b667-85db6d82e4df.name: Agile Administrators Program

issuer.summary: issued by American Council on Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have to submit a digital portfolio that represents their philosophy and accomplishments as a leader of agile innovation in higher education. In addition, at least two artifacts that reflect their understanding and applications of each of the six Key Competencies (Mindset, Mission & Money, Mapping, Making, Movement & Momentum, Managing). Final step of completion is to present and defend the portfolio to a panel of experienced agile administrators.

d4fb276b-235d-4298-a164-3b38a0133232.description: To provide an overview of the concepts, operating characteristics, and capabilities of modern computer systems and to provide introductory hands-on experience in the use of Microsoft Windows 2000 and Microsoft Office XP software.
d4fb276b-235d-4298-a164-3b38a0133232.name: Computing and Information Technology (v.1)

issuer.summary: issued by American Council on Education

badge_template_activities.title: Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, computer-based training, lectures, classroom exercise.
